example.eg: Luca lives on the second floor.
example.egtrans: 卢卡住二楼。

example.eg: Two full time jobs is no way to live.
example.egtrans: 同时做两份全职工作根本没法过。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 生活, 过活, 过日子

example.eg: The king is not dead!  He lives!
example.egtrans: 国王没有死！他还活着！

example.eg: Yes, he still lives.  He must be ninety years old.
example.egtrans: 对，他还在世，肯定有九十岁了。

example.eg: Cockroaches have lived for millions of years.
example.egtrans: 蟑螂已经存在了数百万年了。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 存在, 生存, 存活

example.eg: We bought live crabs for dinner.
example.egtrans: 晚饭我们买了活蟹来吃。

example.eg: Is this broadcast live or pre-recorded?
example.egtrans: 这个节目是现场直播还是预先录制的？

trans_examp.trans_cn: 现场直播的, 实况转播的

dsense.name: live
dsense.guideword: (perform: in front of people) (报道、转播等)

example.eg: The comedian loved performing live.
example.egtrans: 那喜剧演员喜欢现场表演。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 现场的，在场的，当场的，当面的

example.eg: Don't touch the coals from the fire; they are still live.
In training, the army uses blanks instead of live ammunition.
example.egtrans: 训练时，军队使用的是空弹而非实弹。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 装着炸药的, 实弹的

example.eg: Don't touch the wires; they are still live with electricity.
example.egtrans: 电线还通着电，不要乱碰。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 有电的, 带电的, 通电的

example.eg: The ball was still live because it had not gone out of bounds.
example.egtrans: 因为球并没有出界，所以是有效的。

example.eg: The comedian loved performing in front of a live audience.
example.egtrans: 这名喜剧演员喜欢在现场观众面前表演。

example.eg: We are broadcasting live from the scene of the protest.
example.egtrans: 我们正在抗议现场进行直播。

example.eg: Many people around the world live on less than a dollar per day.
example.egtrans: 世界上有许多人每日靠不到一美元过活。

example.eg: You can't work all your life; you have to live!
example.egtrans: 你不能一辈子就知道工作，你得享受生活乐趣！

trans_examp.trans_cn: 过愉快的生活, 享受生活乐趣

example.eg: Many monks live a Spartan life.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 过某种生活, 以某种方式生活

example.eg: He still lives the war in his imagination.
He lives a moral life, as he speaks a moral life.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 以…方式生活, 过着…的生活

example.eg: They are still married, but they live apart, in different towns.
His friends ensured that he could never live down the day he accidentally wore his sister's pants.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 通过努力让人们忘记自己的尴尬事

example.eg: The hotel staff live in so they don't have to travel home after work.
example.egtrans: 酒店工作人员就住在工作的地方，这样下班后他们就不用长途跋涉地回家了。

example.eg: The widow lives off her late husband's pension and Social Security checks.
example.egtrans: 那个寡妇靠她过世丈夫的退休金和社保过活。

example.eg: My mother gives me a monthly allowance but I couldn't live on just that.
example.egtrans: 我妈每个月会给我零用钱，不过我不能就靠那个为生。

example.eg: Although a great performer has died today, his memory will live on.
example.egtrans: 一名伟大的表演大师在今天陨落了，但他的精神将永存世间。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 继续生存下去, 永存, 继续存在

example.eg: She lived out her last years in the same small town.
example.egtrans: 她在同一个小镇上度过了晚年。

dsense.name: live out
dsense.guideword: US (domestic, etc; not reside in house of employer) (佣工等)

example.eg: Granddad's caregiver lives out, but she spends 12 hours a day at his home.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 不住在雇主家里, 住在店外, 外宿

example.eg: He urged his students to live out their dreams.
example.egtrans: 他力劝学生们要去实现自己的梦想。

example.eg: Our grandparents lived through the War and know what it is like to lose everything.
She made every effort to live up to her ideals.
example.egtrans: 她尽一切努力来达到自己的理想。

example.eg: The new website went live last week.
After many years of flat-sharing, it is a luxury to live alone.
When I was a teenager I lived and breathed ballet.
Live and learn is my motto; we all learn from our own mistakes.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 真是活到老学到老, 真想不到

example.eg: Those two men used to fight a lot, but now they have decided to live and let live.
They might as well be married; they've been living for years as husband and wife.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 同居, 夫妻共同生活

example.eg: George lives at his mom's house because he is not able to afford an apartment for himself yet.

dsense.name: live by [sth]
dsense.guideword: figurative (take as a rule for life)

example.eg: Never give up is a good rule to live by if you hope to have success in life.

dsense.name: live by your wits, live on your wits

trans_examp.trans_cn: 放纵地生活, 不羁地生活

example.eg: Classic movies like "Casablanca" will live forever in the hearts of movie-goers.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 永存, 永生, 恒久流传

dsense.name: live from hand to mouth, live hand to mouth

example.eg: Though they appeared wealthy, they actually lived from hand to mouth.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 仅能糊口, 勉强度日

example.eg: Rock stars are known for living hard and dying young.
They lived high while in Thailand because everything was so cheap there.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 过奢侈放纵的生活, 挥霍无度地过日子

dsense.name: live high on the hog, live high off the hog, eat high off the hog

trans_examp.trans_cn: 过奢华生活, 享受豪华生活

example.eg: Can't you just live in peace with your neighbors?
Half the world lives in poverty while the other half throws away good food.
Jacob and Polly aren't married; they're living in sin.
Live it up while you are still young and beautiful.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 尽情享乐, 尽情挥霍

example.eg: It's all right to live it up once in a while; a few beers won't hurt you.
There's something special about seeing live music instead of just listening to a recording.

dsense.name: live off the fat of the land, live on the fat of the land

trans_examp.trans_cn: 过衣食无忧的生活, 饫甘餍肥

example.eg: If you continue to smoke, soon you'll be living on borrowed time.
Man cannot live on bread alone.
Louise likes to take risks and live on the edge.
After living on his own for many years, he has moved back in with his parents.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 独自生活, 独立居住

example.eg: The band gave a live performance of their new song.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 现场演出, 现场表演

example.eg: I prefer edited programs rather than live shows.
This tape was recorded at his live show in New York.
If you lived simply you wouldn't have to work such long hours.

dsense.name: live the high life
dsense.guideword: informal (have a luxurious lifestyle) (非正式用语)

example.eg: Ever since he won the lottery he's been living the high life.
Don't worry - times are hard because of the recession but you'll live through it.
A year after they started dating, they decided to live together.

dsense.name: live up to [sb]'s expectations, live up to expectations

example.eg: I fear I will never live up to my parents' expectations.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 不负所望, 满足期望

example.eg: Let's hope their new player lives up to his billing and scores a few goals!
We're not rich, but we live well.
CAUTION: LIVE WIRES OVERHEAD.
That kid is such a live wire!  He never stays still!

trans_examp.trans_cn: 精力充沛的人，活跃的人

example.eg: I once lived with someone who would never wash the dishes.

dsense.name: live with [sth]
dsense.guideword: (accept or endure: [sth]) (多指不佳的境遇等)

example.eg: His disease is incurable - he'll just have to live with it.
My mother is disabled and has to have a live-in carer.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 住在雇主家的, 住在工作场所的

example.eg: The crowd shouted with one voice: "Long live the king!".
